intro: Ebenus laguroides subsp. pisidica, commonly known as the Caucasian thornvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers. The species belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to other members of the Ebenus genus.
